title: Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve: Plan A Field Trip
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Plan A Field Trip               Plan A Field Trip         Bring your school or group field trip to a Jean Lafitte site to discover Louisiana history, nature, and culture   Field trips and group reservations are welcome at all six sites of the park. Ranger programs cover a variety of topics and many fulfill Louisiana state curriculum requirements or scout badge requirements (check out which sites have special scout programs on the For Teachers page by clicking here). Admission to all sites and most programs is free. Choose a site below or check out the big picture with a map of all the sites.  Barataria Preserve, Marrero, 504-689-3690 ext 25 (nature and science in a wetlands environment) OR e-mail us  Chalmette Battlefield and National Cemetery, Chalmette, 504-281-0510 (site of the Battle of New Orleans)  French Quarter Visitor Center, New Orleans, 504-589-2636 (history and culture)  Acadian Cultural Center, Lafayette, 337-232-0789 (history and culture)  Prairie Acadian Cultural Center, Eunice, 337-457-8499 (history and culture)  Wetlands Acadian Cultural Center, Thibodaux, 985-448-1375 (history and culture)
